title: Disney, Universal, Warner Bros Sue Chinese AI Startup MiniMax
description: Walt Disney Co., Comcast Corp.’s Universal Studios and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. are suing Chinese artificial intelligence startup MiniMax, accusing the company of pirating the studios’ intellectual property. Founded in 2021, Shanghai-based MiniMax has created several generative AI models that run its companion apps, such as video and image editor Hailuo AI and Talkie, a chatbot that competes with Character.AI in the US
content:

title: AiMom: How Chelsea Rizzo Is Making Mompreneurship Easy
description: Artificial intelligence isn’t just changing how corporations scale — it’s also reshaping entrepreneurship at the individual level.  For Chelsea Rizzo, founder of AiMom and Abundant Management, the opportunity is clear: put AI tools directly in the hands of moms building businesses, and you unlock one of the most resilient, creative, and under-supported groups of entrepreneurs […]

title: Govt designates enforcers of Artificial Intelligence Act
description: The Government has designated the competent authorities which will be responsible for the enforcement of the EU Artificial Intelligence Act.
content:
The Government has designated the competent authorities which will be responsible for the enforcement of the EU Artificial Intelligence (AI) Act.

title: Over 200 Google AI subcontractors laid off after complaining about low pay: report
description: More than 200 of Google’s contractors who helped test artificial intelligence products were laid off last month – with the dismissals coming after the workers had complained over low pay and poor working conditions.
content:
More than 200 of Google’s subcontractors who helped test artificial intelligence products were laid off last month – with the dismissals coming after the workers had complained over low pay and poor working conditions.

title: India and Venezuela Strengthen Ties with Digital and AI Collaborations
description: India and Venezuela are exploring collaborative efforts in Digital Public Infrastructure and Artificial Intelligence to improve areas like payments, citizen services, and education. High-level discussions reaffirm the enduring bilateral relations and mutual cooperation across multilateral platforms, solidifying their partnership, especially in digital transformation initiatives.
content: India and Venezuela are advancing discussions aimed at fortifying their alliance through Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) applications. These collaborative talks, focusing on crucial areas such as payments and citi... [859 chars]

title: Some judges move beyond fines to keep lawyers' AI errors in check
description: As more and more phony case citations and other artificial intelligence errors show up in legal filings, some judges are experimenting with alternatives to traditional court sanctions to deter lawyers from relying on chatbots and other AI tools without checking their work.

title: How AI is undermining learning and teaching in universities
description: Letter: Prof Leo McCann and Prof Simon Sweeney say student misuse of generative artificial intelligence is widespread and we must be sceptical of its usefulness

title: Zoom CEO Eric Yuan joins Jensen Huang and Bill Gates in echoing revolutionary AI prediction that could end the conventional office grind
description: Zoom CEO Eric Yuan has joined Bill Gates and Nvidias Jensen Huang in predicting that artificial intelligence could drastically shorten the workweek. In an interview with The New York Times, Yuan said AIs rapid progress may allow people to achieve more with less effort, paving the way for three-day weeks. While he stresses the need to rethink productivity beyond logged hours, the shift promises both hope for balance and concerns over inequality.
content:
